1000: Always good to see you, %pcf! Listen, %pcf, this is kind of a strange story. The priests of _temple_ are having a problem with some "abhorrent abominations"  -as they put it- haunting their temple. Well obviously the deceased patrons of _temple_ that were buried in the temple's crypt are not at peace. Strangely enough they do not attack the priests, but for the order they represent a terrible sacrilege, and they are not so courteous as not to attack the faithful visitors. Well, since the priests efforts to dispel the undead were unsuccessful, they approached us to apply a less subtle method to put the dead back where they belong. Pay is _gold_ gold, and if you are nice they will probably reward you with some holy reliquary that is worth much more. do you want to help them, %pcf?
1001: Obviously you do not care for _temple_. I know that undead are a smelly, unpleasant lot, but I can't offer you to slay dragons every day, you know?
1002: Well then, you gotta go to __temple_. Go there and kill the walking dead once more. Your deadline on this one is =questtime_ days. I guess the priest will be able to tell you when you found and killed all of them.   Oh, and a word of advice, %pcf, watch your back! Not because of the undead, I trust you know how to deal with them. But the whole story reeks of necromancy, and that is a dangerous affair to meddle in.
1004: Did you ever find out what raised the undead in that temple, %pcf?
1005: _temple_! I will not set foot there again! They are in league with the Necromancers!
1006: An army of undead has attacked %reg. They were beaten, but at great cost of lives.
1007: I heard the Fighters Guild sent some %ra over to kill the undead in that temple.
1008: Welcome, %pcf. You are one of our most successful members by now. I hope you dont want my job?
1009: The temple ended up hiring the mages guild. Cost them a lot more, but they got the job done.
1010: %qdt: The Fighters Guild of ___questgiver_ has asked me fight some undead in  _temple_ in __temple_. I have =questtime_ days to report back to _questgiver_ in the guild.
1011: It is too late now to claim the reward for fighting the undead in _temple_.
1012: You must be %pcn. I am _priest_ of ==priest_. I came here to help these brothers against the undead. But we were helpless, a powerful will seemed to protect the walking dead. I don't know why they haunt this temple, but it seems they have been searching for something in the crypt. Here, take this Holy Relic as a sign of the deepest gratitude from _temple_.
1014: %dat: In __mondung_ I have found and killed an ancient lich-king. The place was swarming with undead, but the evil will that possessed  them vanished when the lich died.
1015: This place has a foul smell to it.
1016: This is the reward the priest in __temple_ gave to me as a reward.
1020: A priest approaches you: That's apparently all of them, I have not seen any others around. _temple_ will not forget your deed!
1030: After a last fearful blow the evil light fades from the eyes of the undead.   With an eerie voice it whispers:   "Cold is bone and marrow dark the hidden barrow where the one with steel crowned head made awake the sleeping dead To his decay shall fall the land in __mondung_ he raised his hand"
1031: %dat I have fulfilled my contract  with _temple_, but I am feeling uneasy. The dying undead cited a strange verse: "Cold is bone and marrow dark the hidden barrow where the one with steel crowned head made awake the sleeping dead To his decay shall fall the land in __mondung_ he raised his hand"
1032: On the brittle parchment you can make out a map, drawn in dark lines and adorned with many illegible runes. But you are able to make out the word "__mondung_" and next to it "King"   Attempting to turn the page to see if anything is written on the other side, the parchment crumbles in your hands.
1033: %dat: I found a strange map, that must have come from one of the undead. It revealed the name of  __mondung_.
1034: You, a mere mortal, dare attack me? When you are dead, I shall make you my General!
1035: As the lich-king dies, you feel his evil presence lift from your surroundings. You have saved the land from a great evil.
1036: You have entered the realm of the dead. The living may not walk here.
How dare you enter the halls of the dead?
This is the stronghold of the walking dead. You must join our ranks now.
1037: You have entered the realm of the dead. The living may not walk here.
Our King shall not be disturbed
Cold is bone and marrow dark the hidden barrow where the one with steel crowned head made awake the sleeping dead
1038: You have entered the realm of the dead. The living may not walk here.
How dare you enter the halls of the dead?
To his decay shall fall the land in __mondung_ he has raised his hand
1039: I don't have time for you right now, %pcf.
1040: A lich-king you say? I dont know if I buy that story but it sure is a good one!
